content:
• Tuesday, September 11, 2018
  • ATHN

    Athenahealth up 1% after hours following teaser tweet on sale

    • Athenahealth (NASDAQ:ATHN) is up 1% after hours in apparent reaction to a tweet from M&A reporter Bhavna Kaul about a "detailed sale update" that was supposedly published. Developing....
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 PM
  • FOMX

    Foamix Pharma +54% as acne drug meets goals in late-stage trial

    • Foamix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:FOMX) +54.4% after-hours on news that topline results of its third Phase 3 clinical trial of its FMX101 drug for the treatment of moderate-to-severe acne met both primary endpoints.
    • The company says the topical minocycline foam showed significant reduction in the number of inflammatory lesions in the trial which enrolled more than 1,500 patients with moderate to severe acne.
    • “This is the most significant milestone to date for Foamix," says CEO David Domzalski. "If approved, we believe FMX101 would be the first topical minocycline product available for patients in the United States.”
     
     
     
     
    | 7:25 PM
  • LPI

    Laredo Petroleum +5.4% on move to SmallCap 600; HQY, WCG moving indexes

    • Laredo Petroleum Holdings (NYSE:LPI) is up 5.4% after hours on word it's moving into the S&P SmallCap 600.
    • The move is effective prior to the open on Monday, Sept. 17.
    • The stock is heading into the 600 to replace HealthEquity (NASDAQ:HQY), which is moving up to the MidCap 400. HQY is 0.1% lower after hours.
    • And HealthEquity is taking the place in the 400 of WellCare Health Plans (NYSE:WCG), which is joining the S&P 500 to replace XL Group (NYSE:XL), set to be acquired by AXA. WCG is 0.1% lower after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • GILD

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (09/11/2018)

    • Top Gainers: GILD +2.3%. AOI +1.7%. RENN +1.4%. STM +1.5%.
    • Top Losers: BFR -4.2%. NLY -2.2%. KOF -2.1%. CPG -2.0%. DOCU -1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM | 11 Comments
  • CADE

    Cadence Bancorp -1.6% on 12.1M-share sale from stockholders

    • Cadence Bancorporation (NYSE:CADE) is 1.6% lower after hours following a prospectus where a number of selling stockholders are offering an aggregate 12.1M shares.
    • Selling stockholders include a Danish pension plan that will exit a 4.06% stake, an Oregon public employees retirement fund that will get out of 2.03%, and the University of Texas Board of Regents exiting a 1.62% stake. CalPERS is also selling most of its 1.73%.
    • Executive officers and directors selling substantial share stakes include Chairman/CEO Paul Murphy Jr., President Samuel Tortorici, Executive VP R.H. Holmes IV, and CFO Valerie Toalson.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • PGTI

    PGT Innovations offering shares; stock slips more than 3% post-close

    • PGT Innovations (NYSE:PGTI) is selling 7M shares with underwriter greenshoe of 1.05M shares.
    • Proceeds will be used to pay down debt.
    • Shares down 3.65% after hours.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • NLY

    Capital raise for Annaly

    • The company is offering 75M shares, with underwriter greenshoe for up to another 11.25M shares.
    • Bloomberg is reporting the shares as being offered at $10.17 each vs. today's close of $10.48. Annaly's (NYSE:NLY) June 30 book value was reported at $10.35.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 14 Comments
  • GILD

    Gilead's filgotinib successful in late-stage study in treatment-resistant rheumatoid arthritis

    • Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD) and collaboration partner Galapagos NV (NASDAQ:GLPG) announce positive results from a Phase 3 clinical trial, FINCH 2, evaluating JAK1 inhibitor filgotinib in adult patients with moderate-to-severe active rheumatoid arthritis (RA) who had failed to respond adequately to or were intolerant of biologic therapies.
    • The study met the primary endpoint of a statistically significant proportion of patients achieving ACR20 (20% improvement in RA symptoms) at week 12 compared to placebo. Specifically, at week 12, 57.5% of patients treated with 100 mg of filgotinib and 66.0% of those treated with 200 mg of filgotinib achieved ACR20 versus 34.5% for placebo (p<0.001).
    • Detailed results will be submitted for presentation at a future medical conference.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 60 Comments
  • STRM

    Streamline Health FQ2 results shy of consensus; shares down 1% after hours

    • Streamline Health Solutions (NASDAQ:STRM) fiscal Q2 loss/share was ($0.08) on revenues of $5.3M (-11%) versus consensus of ($0.03) on revenues of $5.4M.
    • New net bookings: $1.9M. Backlog: $23.4M.
    • Shares are down 1% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 2 Comments
  • UBSFY

    Ubisoft ADRs up 4.2% after JPMorgan raises to Overweight

    • Ubisoft (OTCPK:UBSFY) is up 4.2% in U.S. trading after today's boost to Overweight at JPMorgan, from Neutral.
    • The firm's Daniel Kerven has raised the price target on shares to €130 from €71; shares closed in Paris at €92.28, implying 41% upside in JPMorgan's target.
    • The ADRs are up 39.6% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • STRM

    Streamline Health up 17% ahead of FQ2 earnings report

    • Thinly traded Streamline Health Solutions (STRM +16.9%) is up on more than triple normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 97K shares, ahead of its fiscal Q2 report, to be released after the close.
    • Consensus view is a loss/share of ($0.03) on revenue of $5.4M.
    • Management will host a conference call tomorrow, September 12, at 9:00 am ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • SRTS

    Sensus Healthcare up 13%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Sensus Healthcare (SRTS +13.1%) breaks out of a 12-week base on 70% higher volume, albeit on turnover of only 36K shares.
    • No particular news accounts for the action, but its updated investor presentation says its installed base of SRT-100s, used to treat skin cancer and keloids, is now more than 350, up ~75% since its June 2016 IPO. H1 sales were up 29%.
    • Growth initiatives include a salesforce expansion, a ramp-up in China and an expanded presence in the keloid market.
    • On the capital front, the company had $8.0M in cash and equivalents at the end of June while operations consumed $4.7M in H1.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • BSBR

    Knife attack not enough - rough session for Brazil shares

    • The real had enjoyed the most modest of respites after the stabbing of right-winger Jair Bolsonaro - the thinking being that the attack would generate a sympathy-related rise in the polls.
    • Weekend polls show that's not happening, nor is market-favorite Geraldo Alckmin (who is barely in double-digits) on the rise. While Bolsonaro may get the most first-round votes, polls show he's likely to lose in a second-round match-up against just one left-winger.
    • The iShares MSCI Brazil Capped ETF (EWZ -3.6%). Banks: Santander Brasil (BSBR -5.7%), Itau (ITUB -4.6%), Bradesco (BBD -4.8%). Vale (VALE -2.1%), Petrobas (PBR -4%), Embraer (ERJ -1.5%), Gol Linhas (GOL -6.5%), Saneamento Basico (SBS -2.9%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 67 Comments
  • TEF

    Telefonica -1.5% after JPMorgan drops to Underweight

    • Telefonica (NYSE:TEF) is down 1.5% in U.S. trading after a downgrade at JPMorgan to Underweight, from Neutral.
    • That marks just one of a handful of Sell-equivalent ratings, against more than a dozen each Buy and Hold ratings on the stock.
    • TEF is down 10% this month and has fallen 18.5% in 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • RENN

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (09/11/2018)

    • Gainers: RENN +59%. IZEA +28%. CDLX +14%. STRM +13%. IDTI +11%.
    • Losers: USAT -37%. OTC:NLST -36%. NH -9%. INOD -8%. HEAR -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • AIR

    AAR -6% after SunTrust downgrades on tight labor conditions in MRO unit

    • AAR Corp. (AIR -5.8%) sinks after SunTrust downgrades shares to Hold from Buy with a $47 price target, trimmed from $50, citing tight labor conditions in AAR's maintenance, repair and overhaul business as well as the delays associated with new 737MAX and A320NEO production, which combine to create a weaker than normal Q1 environment for the company.
    • SunTrust's Michael Ciarmoli maintains a bullish view on the aero aftermarket with an opportunity for AAR to exploit its position while reaping benefits from its INL Global Aviation Support Services contract, but he also thinks the company's near-term growth will come under pressure from the MRO unit.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • VFC

    VF Corp investor meeting preview

    • VF Corp (VFC -0.1%) is on watch ahead of an analyst meeting scheduled for tomorrow.
    • The company says the meeting will provide investors an overview of the Vans brand long-term growth strategy, including discussion on key innovation, product initiatives and 2023 financial growth targets.
    • It's also possible the implications of the VF split of the denim business from the apparel/footwear/work lifestyle business will be a topic. Vans is sticking with the Timberland, The North Face and Dickies brands after the separation.
    • Speakers at the analyst meeting include VF Chairman Steve Rendle, CEO Scott Roe, CFO Kevin Bailey and other members of the Vans brand’s senior management team.
    • The meeting is set for 11:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • NOA

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (09/11/2018)

    • Gainers: NOA +8%. GEVO +7%. TGA +7%. SOI +6%. SLCA +6%.
    • Losers: SD -18%. KRO -11%. CC -9%. ZN -8%. TROX -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 5 Comments
  • TRMD

    Torm bounces off 52-week low

    • Shipper Torm Plc (NASDAQ:TRMD) bounces off a 52-week low with a 16% break higher today.
    • Torm reported last month that the company's product order tanker book as a percentage of the fleet was its second lowest level since 1996.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • HD

    Hurricane Florence anxiety sends HD, LOW and LL higher

    • Home Depot (HD +1.6%), Lowe's (LOW +1.4%) and Lumber Liquidators (LL +1.6%) all move higher again after the forecast for Hurricane Florence worsens.
    • The Category 4 hurricane could be the worst storm to hit the East Coast in decades. Over one million people are under a mandatory evacuation order.
    • The hurricane is expected to make landfall on Friday morning and create widespread flooding, power and wind-related issues.
    • Hurricane Florence forecast cone
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM | 8 Comments
  • MU

    Micron -3.6% after RBC target cut on memory concerns

    • RBC Capital lowers its Micron (NASDAQ:MU) price target from $83 to $70 due to memory cycle headwinds.
    • Analyst Amit Daryanani sees ongoing NAND ASP declines and likely DRAM ASP headwinds next year. 
    • RBC earlier cut Western Digital (WDC -3.4%) on memory concerns, which pulled down storage drive competitor Seagate Tech (STX -1.9%).  
    • Micron shares are down 3.6% to $43.30.  
    • Previously: RBC downgrades Western Digital on NAND headwinds (Sept. 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 134 Comments
  • RUN

    Sunrun raised to Buy at BAML as H2 looks more favorable

    • Sunrun (RUN +6.3%) surges the most in four months after BofA Merrill Lynch upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral with a $17 price target, up from $16, saying concerns related to RUN's execution risk and cost trajectory have eased and recent weakness in the stock limits downside risk.
    • BAML analyst Julien Dumoulin-Smith says H2 2018 looks more favorable for RUN in terms of deployments and cost reductions, and the company has longer-term support from recent legislation including the SB100 bill signed in California which calls for the state to be fully green-powered by 2045.
    • The firm also cites expectations for management to deploy some of its guided cash generation of $50M in 2018 and $100M in 2019 for a safe harbor stockpile or even buybacks.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • ATVI

    Stifel adds Activision Blizzard to Select List, raises Take-Two's target

    • Stifel adds Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI) to its Select List while maintaining a Buy rating and $82 price target, a 10% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • Analyst Drew Crum cites solid holiday expectations, anticipation ahead of potential catalyst BlizzCon, and further news and momentum for the Overwatch League.   
    • The firm also maintains a Buy rating on Take-Two (NASDAQ:TTWO) and raises its target from $137 to $144, a nearly 12% upside to yesterday’s close. (Source: StreetAccount). 
    • ATVI shares are up 6.3% to $78.92. TTWO shares are up 3.7% to $133.96.    
    • Previously: Stifel lowers EA's upside, removes from Select List (Sept. 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 6 Comments
  • CIDM

    Cinedigm rallies after inking deal for The Aurora Games

    • Cinedigm (CIDM +28.9%) announces that it landed the exclusive global digital rights to The Aurora Games.
    • The Aurora Games is an all-female sports and entertainment platform due to launch next August to celebrate women's accomplishments and visions.
    • The deal includes live streaming rights and video device rights.
    • The Aurora Game has gained support from a group of high profile advisors including Donna de Varona, Chris Evert, Nadia Comanici, Nancy Kerrigan and Jackie Joyner Kersee.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • OXBR

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (09/11/2018)

    • Gainers: OXBR +13%. GEC +8%. IRET +6%. SIEB +5%. CPSS +5%.
    • Losers: MHLD -14%. WHLR -9%. SUPV -6%. JP -6%. GGAL -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • COUP

    Northland downgrades Coupa Software with upside target

    • Northland Capital Markets downgrades Coupa Software (NASDAQ:COUP) from Outperform to Market Perform with an $85 price target, a 9% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • Coupa shares are up 1.3% to $79.02.  
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • CREE

    Roth steps to Buy on Cree

    • Roth upgrades Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) from Neutral to Buy with a $60 price target, a 38% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • Cree shares are down 0.9% to $43.22.  
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM | 6 Comments
  • RENN

    Midday Gainers / Losers (09/11/2018)

    • Gainers: RENN +58%. IZEA +39%. AOI +34%. IVTY +28%. CIDM +25%. NBY +19%. HAIR +18%. OXBR +17%. PRQR +14%. OTC:DCTH +13%.
    • Losers: FRAN -33%. USAT -32%. SONO -20%. FRED -19%. BLPH -18%. SD -18%. LMNR -17%. FNKO -16%. MHLD -14%. IIN -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • PPIH

    More on Perma-Pipe International Q2 results

    • Perma-Pipe International (PPIH -0.2%) reported Q2 sales growth of 20.4% Y/Y to $32.33M due to increased sales in Canada, the Middle East and India.
    • Q2 Gross margin improved by 684 bps to 18.23% and operating margin recovered by 984 bps to 2%.
    • G&A expenses decrease by 2% Y/Y to $3.92M and selling expenses were $1.32M (-1% Y/Y).
    • Company has a backlog of $65.1M as of July 31, 2018.
    • Cash, and cash equivalents and restricted cash of $6.35M compared to $9.44M a year ago. Debt totaled $17.2M as on July 31, 2018.
    • Cash used in operating activities during the first six months of 2018 was $3.5M, compared to $2.8M a year ago.
    • Previously: Perma-Pipe International reports Q2 results (Sept. 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • AMD

    Rosenblatt raises AMD target to 34% upside on Nvidia competition

    • Rosenblatt raises its AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) price target from $30 to $40, a 34% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • Analyst Hans Mosesmann: "AMD's move over the past several quarters and going forward reminds us of the setup we witnessed with Nvidia (NVDA +0.2%) nearly 3-years ago when that company transformed from a PC graphics play to a compute powerhouse." 
    • Mosesmann notes that, until now, AMD had not meaningfully entered AI training and inference tech. AMD’s 7nm Radeon GPU is coming six to 12 months ahead of Nvidia’s 7nm product. 
    • The analyst thinks AMD’s new server chips and GPUs will generate gross profit margins of over 65%. 
    • AMD shares are up 1% to $30.18.   
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 346 Comments
  • PYX

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (09/11/2018)

    • Gainers: AOI +32%. MPX +7%.
    • Losers: SONO -19%. LMNR -18%. FNKO -11%. SGOC -9%. BTN -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 4 Comments
  • HAIR

    Restoration Robotics up 16%

    • Restoration Robotics (HAIR +16.3%) breaks out of brief consolidation on 33% higher volume. Shares have rallied almost 90% in a month since its $1.50/share stock offering.
    • The company markets a robotic hair restoration system called ARTAS. Its next generation device, ARTAS iX, was launched in the U.S. two months ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 3 Comments
  • W

    Wayfair runs to new high

    • Wayfair (NYSE:W) is up 3.15% as investor sentiment remains strong on the retailer.
    • Shares of Wayfair are up 79% YTD and carved out a new all-time high of $143.30 earlier in today's session.
    • You don't have to go too far way to hear the bearish argument on Wayfair. Citron Research posted an update on Seeking Alpha two weeks ago that still resonates.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 12 Comments
  • IVITF

    Invictus nabs conditional approval from Canadian province for cannabis supply; shares up 5%

    • The Saskatchewan Liquor and Gaming Authority has granted conditional approval to Invictus MD Strategies (OTCQX:IVITF +5.2%) subsidiary Acreage Farms Ltd. to become a registered cannabis supplier once recreational use of marijuana becomes legal on October 17.
    • Invictus says its product portfolio includes 69 Health Canada-approved cannabis strains that will be sold under the brand names Dukes, Zooey, Sterling & Hunt and Sinister.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 4 Comments
  • FNKO

    Funko breaks lower after monster rally

    • Funko (NASDAQ:FNKO) is 9.0% lower as investors ease off after a monster 90-day rally that pushed shares up 140% to as high as $31.12.
    • SA Marketplace author Lutz Muller was away ahead of the rally with his recommendation on Funko back in March when the stock was swapping hands at around $7.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 16 Comments
  • SONC

    Sonic +8% after sales, EPS update

    • Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC) is up 8.4% after reporting preliminary FQ4 results.
    • The restaurant operator says same-store sales rose 2.6% during the quarter to top the consensus estimate for a 2.0% gain. Traffic was up 2.5%.
    • Sonic estimates FQ4 EPS of $0.51 to $0.52 vs. $0.50 consensus.
    • Full FQ4 results will be posted on October 16.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • IVTY

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (09/11/2018)

    • Gainers: IVTY +28%. PRQR +14%. NBY +13%. BNGOU +13%. HAIR +12%.
    • Losers: BLPH -20%. XBIT -18%. SLNO -10%. PACB -10%. EVFM -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 2 Comments
  • CASY

    Casey's General Stores up 8.2% post Q1 results

    • Casey's General Stores (CASY +8.6%) reports Q1 revenue growth of 23.9% Y/Y to $2.59B.
    • Segment revenue: For Fuel total gallons sold were up 6.5% Y/Y to 601.8M gallons; Grocery & other merchandise increased 7.9% Y/Y to $644.8M & Prepared Food & Fountain increased 7.3% Y/Y to $281M.
    • Same-store Sales: Fuel up 0.5%; Grocery & Other Merchandise up 3.2% & Prepared Food and Fountain up 1.7%.
    • Average Margin: Fuel 20.5 cents per gallon; Grocery & Other Merchandise of 32.4%; Prepared Food and Fountain of 62%.
    • Total operating expenses increased 11.9% Y/Y to $359.4M.
    • Declared a quarterly dividend of $0.29 per share payable November 15, 2018.
    • The Company repurchased the initial $300M repurchase program authorized in March 2017, repurchasing ~352,592 shares.
    • 2019 Outlook: Same-store Sales: Fuel (Gallons and CPG) 1.5-3.0%; Grocery and Other Merchandise 1.5-3.0%; Prepared Food and Fountain 1.5-3.5%. Average Margin: Fuel (Gallons and CPG) 18.5–20.5%; Grocery and Other Merchandise 31.5- 32.5%; Prepared Food and Fountain 60-62%. Operating Expenses of 8.5-10.5%, New Store Construction of 60 stores, Acquisitions 20+ stores.
    • Previously: Caseys General Stores beats by $0.24, beats on revenue (Sept. 10)
    • Previously: Caseys General Stores declares $0.29 dividend (Sept. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • OCC

    Optical Cable down 2% post Q3 results

    • Optical Cable (OCC -2.4%) reported Q3 revenue growth of 40.7% Y/Y to $23.12M due to increased net sales in its specialty markets.
    • Q3 Gross profit increased by 32.4% Y/Y to $7M and margin declined by 190 bps to 30.4%, due to changes in fiber optic cable product mix.
    • Q3 operating margin recovered by 387 bps to 2.9%
    • SG&A expenses were $6.4M an increase of 17.4% Y/Y and margin was 27.6% down by 540 bps.
    • "Our positive third quarter results reflect the continued momentum of our growth strategies and again demonstrate OCC's strong operating leverage at higher sales levels.  Our sales order backlog/forward load at the end of the third quarter was $8.6 million, which we believe will contribute to a strong finish to the fiscal year”, commented, Neil Wilkin, President and CEO.
    • Previously: Optical Cable reports Q3 results (Sept. 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • CG

    Carlyle Group, Diamondback Energy to partner in developing Permian assets

    • Carlyle Group (CG -0.2%) and Diamondback Energy (FANG +2.3%) say they will jointly invest $620M to develop oil and gas assets in the San Pedro area of Pecos County in west Texas' Permian Basin.
    • As part of the joint venture, Carlyle Energy Mezzanine Opportunities Fund II will fund up to 85% of the development program over five years and its interests will largely revert to FANG after certain performance milestones are met.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • MTCH

    Match launches Tinder Top Picks globally, hits new high

    • Match Group (NASDAQ:MTCH) hits new highs after launching the curated Top Picks feature for Tinder Gold subscribers worldwide.
    • Top Picks had a quiet launch last week in the U.S. and UK after a test period in several countries including Germany, Brazil, France, and Canada.   
    • The Top Picks feature suggests potential matches based on profile information like education, hobbies, and interests. Picks will refresh daily, or users can pay to receive more “packs” of picks in increments of 10. 
    • Match shares are up 0.8% to $53.70, retreating from the intraday (and 52-week) high of $54.85.    
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 3 Comments
  • SMTX

    SMTC opens new supply chain center of excellence in Phoenix

    • SMTC Corporation (SMTX +4.2%) announced the opening of its supply chain center in Phoenix, AZ to support growth and enable continued sourcing advantage.
    • CEO Ed Smith: “While supply chain challenges reported by many of our peers continue to affect the industry, SMTC’s focus on supply chain excellence and the emphasis we have placed on this very important part of the business continues to provide exceptional results for our customers in these unprecedented times".
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • YUMC

    Yum China -16% as takeover premium fades

    • Yum China (NYSE:YUMC) is down 15.7% on reports that a consortium led by Hillhouse Capital is giving up on efforts to acquire the restaurant operator.
    • Sources tell Bloomberg that Hillhouse feels Yum China's business has worsened amid the broader economic downturn in China.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 12 Comments
  • PYPL

    KeyBanc raises PayPal target on Venmo debit card potential

    • KeyBanc reiterates an Overweight rating on PayPal (NASDAQ:PYPL) and raises the price target by $5 to $105, a 17% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • Analyst Josh Beck cites incremental opportunities for the debit card that had a soft launch in June. 
    • Beck sees the Venmo debit card as a meaningful launch in part because it opens up the offline opportunity, which has 9x the TAM of e-commerce. 
    • PYPL shares are up 1.2% to $90.89.  
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 6 Comments
  • ROKU

    Roku +2.8% on KeyBanc boost to Street-high target

    • KeyBanc maintains an Overweight rating on Roku (NASDAQ:ROKU) and raises the target from $67 to a Street-high $81, a nearly 18% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • Analyst Evan Wingren cites updated data from channel checks that “point to stable growth” and suggest an upside to the firm’s Q3 estimates due to continued adoption of ad-supported streaming. 
    • Roku shares are up 2.8% to $70.64.  
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 15 Comments
  • GNRC

    Generac bid up ahead of hurricane

    • Generac Holdings (NYSE:GNRC) is up 1.6% as investors expect the company to see a boost in sales related to Hurricane Florence.
    • Generac carved out a new 52-week high of $60.68 earlier in the day.
    • Shares of Generac are up 8.9% over the last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • RENN

    Premarket Gainers as of 9:05 am (09/11/2018)

    • RENN +66% on Q2 result.
    • IZEA +55% on signing top 50 U.S. retailer.
    • IVTY +29% on being acquired by Stryker.
    • SSC-OLD +27% on signing $6B deal.
    • CDMO +20% on Q1 result.
    • SIGA +12% on awarded contract.
    • IDTI +12% on being acquired by Renesas.
    • TLRY +7% asTilray 2:100 successfully imported into the United Kingdom, to supply a pediatric patient in need.
    • GLPG +6%.
    • RUN +6% on expanding solar access to affordable housing communities.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • OSTK

    Overstock.com CEO sells shares

    • Overstock.com (NASDAQ:OSTK) is lower in premarket action after CEO Patrick Byrne discloses that he sold about 10% of his holdings in order to reinvest a bulk of it in two co-investments with Overstock and Medici Ventures.
    • Byrne statement:"I feel very encouraged by the speed of improvements in our retail business (which also makes me comfortable taking this moment to sell).   • COCP

    SEC charges against billionaire Phillip Frost may be 'tip of the iceberg" - Barron's

    • Barron's reports that the SEC's stock fraud charges against billionaire biotech investor Phillip Frost and others may uncover more widespread stock manipulation schemes.
    • The SEC's complaint accuses Frost and certain associates, including penny stock promoter Barry Honig, of "pump-and-dump" promotion schemes to inflate the prices of three tiny companies, believed to be Cocrystal Pharma (NASDAQ:COCP), MGT Capital Investments (OTCQB:MGTI) and MabVax Therapeutics (OTCPK:MBVX).
    • Last year, OPKO and Frost were sued by a former CoCrystal patent attorney accusing Frost of using CoCrystal and other companies in "pump-and-dump" schemes. A federal magistrate has recommended that a motion to dismiss submitted by the defendants be granted, citing the lack of jurisdiction in Minnesota where the lawsuit was filed.
    • Mr. Honig has a long history in the penny stock sphere. He, along with Frost and Michael Brauser, is connected to PolarityTE (COOL), Eloxx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ELOX) and ChromaDex (NASDAQ:CDXC), although none have been accused of wrongdoing in connection with these stocks. PolarityTE Chief Investment Officer John Stetson, one of the defendants in the SEC case, was recently let go.
    • Mr. Brauser recently resigned as Chairman of software developer Red Violet (NASDAQ:RDVT), countering that he intended to "defend himself vigorously" against the SEC's "baseless" charges.
    • Honig and Brauser earned a windfall in Riot Blockchain (NASDAQ:RIOT) which jumped 10-fold amidst the blockchain frenzy in late 2017. CEO John O'Rourke, another defendant in the SEC case, resigned over the weekend.
    • Previously: SEC charges Frost and Honig with stock promotion schemes; OPKO down 18% (Sept. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM | 47 Comments

    Macau casino stocks tumble on growth concerns

    • The selling pressure continues in Macau. MGM China (OTCPK:MCHVY, OTCPK:MCHVF) fell 7.42% in Hong Kong trading today, while Wynn Macau (OTCPK:WYNMY, OTCPK:WYNMF) was down 3.28% and Sands China (OTCPK:SCHYY, OTCPK:SCHYF) peeled off 3.72%.
    • Deutsche Bank may have been a factor in the action after the investment firm slashed its Macau 2019 gross gaming revenue forecast outlook to +4% from +11%. The investment firm voiced concerns that the +20% tumble in the Hong Kong Hang Seng Index could lead to less VIP traffic.
    • The new 2019 GGR growth estimate from DB also means industry EBITDA growth would come at only +5% for the year vs. +13% consensus.
